17.summary:
The document outlines various discount programs available for diabetic supplies, physical therapy, and hearing aids. For diabetic supplies, customers can receive discounts ranging from 20% to 85% off retail prices. This includes brand name glucose test strips, glucose monitors, lancets, and other related devices. Additionally, discounts are available for blood pressure monitors and urinalysis test strips. The program provides a customer service contact number and a billing number for further assistance and program access.

In the physical therapy and rehabilitation section, the document highlights an average savings of 20% at over 1,200 offices with 4,000 rehabilitation and physical therapy providers across 23 states. This section also provides contact information for customer service and billing inquiries, along with a website for locating providers and accessing the program.

The hearing savings program offers free hearing consultations and exclusive discounts on the latest hearing aid technology. Benefits include free annual hearing consultations at over 3,000 professional locations, exclusive discounts on all hearing aid technologies and styles, a free deluxe warranty program, and up to a 3-year supply of batteries, with 40 cells provided per hearing aid purchased per year. Contact details for customer service and billing are also provided, along with a website for program access and provider location.

18.summary:
The document outlines two key services: medical bill negotiations and discounts on medical supplies and equipment. The medical bill negotiation service allows members to potentially save on medical bills that are not covered by their existing plan benefits. Patient advocates assist in negotiating the costs on behalf of the members. A critical requirement for this service is that the medical bill must be a minimum of $5000 to initiate negotiations, and full payment to the provider or facility is required once a negotiation is accepted.

Additionally, the document highlights a discount program for medical supplies and equipment. Members can save between 20% to 50% on various medical supply needs. The range of items available includes ambulatory aids, bathroom safety items, wheelchairs, scooters, and hospital beds, among others. This program is designed to provide significant savings on essential medical equipment, enhancing accessibility for members.

The document also provides contact information for customer service and billing inquiries, directing members to a specific website for accessing the program and locating providers.

19.summary:
The Laboratory Savings Program provides an efficient, affordable, and confidential solution for medical laboratory testing. Members can access a wide array of medical laboratory tests, gain information on tests and diseases, and purchase lab tests directly from the website. However, this program is not available in New York, New Jersey, or Rhode Island. The program is not provided by AccessOne DMPO, and it is important to note that it is a discount program, not insurance.

The Nutrition section focuses on helping individuals achieve personal health goals, maintain a healthy lifestyle, and manage chronic health conditions through food and diet education. SDO Nutrition offers services and support for weight loss, dietary restrictions, geriatric health, diabetes and high blood pressure management, chronic health conditions management, and nutrition for athletic and fitness training. This program is designed to provide both individuals and groups with the necessary support to manage their health effectively.

20.summary:
The document outlines two distinct services: speech therapy and a 24/7 nurse help line. The speech therapy service utilizes video conferencing technology to deliver live, one-on-one, highly individualized, and interactive sessions worldwide. This telepractice model offers an alternative to traditional therapy, requiring only a computer, high-speed internet, a web camera, and a quiet room. During scheduled sessions, therapists engage with clients using therapeutic activities and exercises. Additional materials and follow-up resources are provided to help patients practice skills learned during sessions. 

The 24/7 nurse help line offers continuous access to registered nurses (RNs) for family health inquiries. This service is available in over 100 languages, providing medical information assistance around the clock. Both services include customer service and billing contact information, directing users to a specific website for program access and provider location. The document emphasizes that these programs are not provided by AccessOne DMPO and are part of a discount program.

21.summary:
The Chiropractic Savings Program provides a free initial consultation and offers up to 50% savings on diagnostic services and x-rays if necessary. Members can also benefit from unlimited treatments with up to 30% savings through a national network of over 12,000 chiropractors. This program is designed to make chiropractic care more affordable and accessible. 

Additionally, the Vitamins & Supplements section highlights that members can save up to 75% off retail pricing on a wide selection of natural products, including vitamins and supplements. This discount program is not provided by AccessOne DMPO and is intended to offer significant savings on health-related products. 

For further assistance, customer service can be reached at 877-271-6559, and billing inquiries can be directed to 732-876-9733. Members can access their program and locate providers by visiting the provided website.

22.summary: The document outlines the terms and conditions of the Health Discount Program Member Agreement provided by AccessOne Consumer Health, Inc. It specifies that the plan is not insurance but offers discounts at certain healthcare providers for medical services. Members are required to pay for all healthcare services but can receive discounts from providers within the discount plan organization. The plan does not make payments directly to providers. The agreement includes the effective date of enrollment, which is shown on the Member ID, and continues month to month until cancellation. Members can cancel their participation within thirty days of the effective date to receive a full refund of any membership fees, minus a processing fee if applicable. After thirty days, cancellation is possible with a pro-rata refund for unused months, provided notification is received at least five business days before the next billing cycle. The plan covers the member and dependent children at no additional charge. Members can apply discounts to participating chiropractors, medical equipment suppliers, and pharmacies, with discounts ranging from 5% to 70%. Dental and vision services are also available at discounted rates. The document emphasizes that this plan is not a qualified health plan under the Affordable Care Act and is not a Medicare prescription drug plan. Members are advised to keep a copy of the agreement for their records.

23.summary: This page provides information about a discount program offered by the National Benefit Builders, Inc. It is important to note that this program is not insurance but rather a discount program. The page is intended for agent use only and includes accreditation details from the Better Business Bureau, indicating a high rating. The content emphasizes the distinction between traditional insurance plans and discount programs, highlighting the benefits of cost savings through discounts on various services. The page does not provide specific details about the types of discounts available or the services covered under the program. Additionally, there are no specific coverage limits, cost structures, or special provisions outlined on this page. The focus is primarily on the program's nature as a discount offering rather than an insurance plan.

1.summary: This document provides an overview of the insurance offerings by Everest Reinsurance Company, specifically focusing on the Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance plan. The plan is offered through NCE and utilizes the Multiplan PPO Network, providing a structured approach to healthcare coverage. The carrier, Everest, is highlighted as the provider of this insurance type, ensuring a reliable network for policyholders. The plan is designed to offer fixed indemnity benefits, which typically involve predetermined payouts for specific medical services, rather than covering the full cost of care. This type of insurance is often used to supplement other health insurance plans, providing additional financial support for medical expenses. The Multiplan PPO Network offers flexibility in choosing healthcare providers, allowing access to a wide range of medical professionals and facilities. This network is known for its extensive reach, which can be beneficial for policyholders seeking diverse healthcare options. The document emphasizes the structured nature of the plan, which is tailored to meet specific healthcare needs through fixed benefit amounts. This approach can help manage healthcare costs effectively, providing a predictable financial framework for medical expenses.

2.summary:
This page provides an overview of how Group Indemnity Insurance can assist clients in managing unexpected medical expenses. The insurance offers fixed payments to help cover costs that may not be fully addressed by traditional medical insurance, such as deductibles, copays, and coinsurance. An example is provided for Plan 1000+, illustrating potential benefits for a 35-year-old woman who incurs expenses after an accident. The plan includes a hospital admission benefit of $1,000, an ER admission benefit of $100, a hospital confinement benefit of $2,000, and a physician office benefit of $75, totaling $3,175. 

The document emphasizes the flexibility of using these benefits for various expenses, including major medical copays, deductibles, transportation, child care, and housekeeping. It highlights the advantages of choosing Everest Group Indemnity Insurance, such as access to a Multiplan PPO Network, direct payment of benefits, and a simplified claims process. 

The page also notes that payouts are estimates and not guaranteed, with variations possible based on individual circumstances and plan offerings. It advises consulting policy documents for a complete description of benefits, exclusions, limitations, and conditions of coverage, as Everest products are limited benefit policies and not intended to substitute major medical insurance.

3.summary:
The document provides detailed information on the Group Fixed Indemnity Plan options, specifically Plan 100, Plan 200, Plan 200+, and Plan 300. Each plan is designed with specific benefits and coverage limits, catering to different needs. All plans have a pre-existing condition limitation of 12-12, meaning conditions that existed 12 months prior to the coverage start date are excluded for the first 12 months of coverage. The underwriting level for all plans is guaranteed issue, ensuring coverage without medical underwriting.

Confinement benefits vary across plans, with Plan 100 offering $100 per day for hospital confinement and $200 for ICU confinement. Plan 200 and Plan 200+ provide $200 per day for hospital confinement and $200 for ICU, while Plan 300 offers $300 per day for both hospital and ICU confinement. Emergency room benefits are consistent across all plans, with a $50 benefit per visit.

Procedure benefits are available only in Plan 200+ and Plan 300, with a combined inpatient and outpatient benefit of $250 per day. Outpatient benefits include lab and X-ray services, with Plan 200 and Plan 200+ offering $50 for each service. Advanced diagnostic services are covered in Plan 200 and Plan 200+ at $50 per service. Physician's office visits are covered at $50 per visit in all plans, with varying limits on the number of visits per certificate year.

The document also highlights specific limitations, such as the exclusion of chiropractic and acupuncture coverage, and emphasizes that benefits are per person. Policy terms and conditions may vary by state, and not all benefits may be available in all states.

4.summary:
The document provides detailed information on the Group Fixed Indemnity Plan options, specifically focusing on Plan 500, Plan 750, Plan 1000, and Plan 1000+. Each plan outlines specific benefits, coverage limits, and eligibility criteria. The plans include a pre-existing condition limitation of 12-12 months, with guaranteed issue underwriting levels. Confinement benefits vary, with hospital confinement coverage ranging from $500 in Plan 500 to $1000 in Plan 1000+. ICU confinement benefits are similarly structured, with amounts increasing from $500 to $1000 across the plans.

Hospital benefits include emergency room visits, with Plan 500 covering $50 per visit and Plan 1000+ covering $100. Hospital admission benefits are only available in Plan 1000+, offering $1000 per admission. Procedure benefits cover surgery and anesthesia, with a maximum of three surgery days per certificate year shared between inpatient and outpatient services. Anesthesia is covered at 25% across all plans.

Outpatient benefits include lab tests, X-rays, advanced diagnostics, and physician's office visits. Coverage for these services ranges from $50 in Plan 500 to $100 in Plan 1000+. The document also highlights specific limitations, such as the exclusion of chiropractic or acupuncture coverage and the absence of a cancellation age. Benefits are per person, and policy terms, conditions, exclusions, and limitations may vary by state.

5.summary:
The document provides an overview of Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance, which is a supplemental health plan offering a fixed monetary benefit for specific covered medical expenses. It is also referred to as indemnity insurance or fee-for-service insurance. The plan allows members to access discounts through participating providers, which can be found at the specified website or by calling the provided number. Advanced Diagnostics covered under this plan include a range of tests such as Angiogram, CT Scan, MRI, and more.

The document clarifies terms like 'Calendar Year,' which spans from January 1st to December 31st, and 'Certificate Year,' which aligns with the Plan Year in the Certificate Schedule. A 'free look period' is available, allowing the Certificate Holder to return the Certificate within 10 days of receipt for any reason. 'Confinement' refers to hospital admission for inpatient services, with benefits paid per day of confinement.

Diagnostic Care is defined as medically necessary procedures to diagnose medical conditions, including tests like X-rays and biopsies. The MultiPlan PPO Network is highlighted as a nationwide network providing additional provider choices with agreed service discounts.

6.summary:
This document outlines the exclusions and limitations associated with the insurance plan, specifying services, supplies, and treatments that are not covered. It details that expenses for certain services will not be considered covered, and no benefits will be payable unless otherwise stated. Specific exclusions include breast surgery related to capsular contraction, augmentation, or reduction mammoplasty, except for medically necessary reconstruction following a mastectomy due to cancer treatment. Cosmetic surgery is excluded unless it is reconstructive and necessary due to trauma or disease. Dental care is not covered except for accidental injury to sound natural teeth within 12 months of a covered accident. 

The document also excludes benefits for elective treatments, experimental or investigational treatments, and injuries resulting from extreme sports such as scuba diving, skydiving, and mountaineering. No benefits are payable for treatments received from family members or for services incurred outside the United States unless under specific emergency conditions. These exclusions highlight the plan's limitations, ensuring that only specified treatments and conditions are eligible for coverage.

7.summary:
The document outlines specific exclusions and limitations on insurance coverage for various conditions and situations. It specifies that no benefits are payable for treatments related to gender-related services, including gender reassignment and treatments aimed at enhancing sexual energy or performance. Additionally, injuries sustained during hazardous activities or occupations, especially those involving compensation, are not covered. This includes activities like skiing, horse riding, and professional sports.

Coverage is also denied for losses resulting from illegal acts or while the insured person is incarcerated. Intoxication exclusions apply, where no benefits are payable if the insured is deemed intoxicated, with specific criteria for determining intoxication levels. Similarly, losses due to narcotic influence are excluded unless prescribed by a physician.

The plan does not cover treatments deemed not medically necessary, and there are exclusions for mental illness and substance abuse, except under certain benefit provisions. Overdose-related medical conditions are not covered unless the substance was used as prescribed. Pregnancy-related treatments are excluded, except in life-threatening situations for the mother. Lastly, losses incurred during military service are not covered, including non-military support roles in military actions.

8.summary:
This document outlines specific exclusions and limitations within the insurance plan, focusing on various scenarios where benefits are not payable. It specifies that no benefits are provided for manipulations of the musculoskeletal system or acupuncture, particularly when related to nerve interference or vertebral column issues. Sports-related injuries, especially those from intercollegiate or professional athletics, are also excluded, although local community sports activities are not affected by this exclusion. 

The plan does not cover losses due to suicide or intentional injury, even if the harm was unintended. Accidents involving unlicensed drivers are excluded unless the driver holds a valid learner's permit and is under instruction. War-related incidents, including acts of terrorism, are not covered unless the insured was a victim of the act. Weight control treatments, including surgeries and fitness programs, are not covered unless deemed medically necessary. 

Workers' compensation-related conditions are excluded if they are eligible for benefits under other laws. Pre-existing conditions are not covered for a continuous period of 12 months, with exceptions for newborns and adopted children. A waiting period is required before certain benefits become payable, with specific provisions for newborn and adopted children. This document provides a detailed account of the limitations and exclusions applicable to the insurance plan.

9.summary:
The Discount Benefit Program Member Handbook provides an overview of the benefits available to members, emphasizing the inclusion of limited medical benefits alongside valuable discount opportunities. This program is designed to supplement existing medical coverage by offering additional savings on various healthcare services. Members can access discounts on a range of services, which may include dental, vision, and prescription drugs, although specific details are not provided in this section.

The handbook highlights that the program is not an insurance plan but rather a discount program aimed at reducing out-of-pocket expenses for members. It is important for members to understand that while they receive discounts, these do not equate to insurance coverage. The program is intended to enhance the affordability of healthcare services through negotiated discounts with participating providers.

Members are encouraged to review the specific terms and conditions of the discount program to fully understand the scope of benefits and any potential limitations. The handbook serves as a guide to help members navigate the available discounts and make informed decisions about their healthcare spending.

10.summary:
This page provides a table of contents for a health discount program, outlining various services and savings options available to members. The document begins with a welcome section, followed by detailed sections on dental and vision services, which are likely to include discounts or savings plans. Pharmacy services are also covered, with a specific mention of brand-name mail-order options, suggesting potential cost-saving opportunities for prescription medications.

Additional sections include CBD products and diabetic supplies, indicating a focus on providing members with access to specialized health products. Physical therapy and rehabilitation services are listed, along with a hearing savings program, which may offer discounts on hearing aids or related services. Medical bill negotiations and medical supplies and equipment are also featured, suggesting assistance in managing healthcare costs and access to necessary medical tools.

The document further includes a laboratory savings program, nutrition services, and speech therapy, highlighting a broad range of health-related services. A 24/7 nurse help line is mentioned, providing members with round-the-clock access to medical advice. Chiropractic savings plans and discounts on vitamins and supplements are also available, emphasizing a holistic approach to health and wellness. The document concludes with a health discount program member agreement, detailing the terms and conditions of membership.

11.summary:
The GapAfford Plus program is designed to help individuals and families save on out-of-pocket medical expenses, regardless of their current insurance status. It offers savings from the first dollar spent, with no limits, by providing access to pre-negotiated rates similar to those available to insurance companies. This program is particularly beneficial for people with high deductible health plans, those without insurance, the under-insured, and individuals who cannot obtain insurance due to pre-existing conditions. It also caters to those whose plans do not cover certain procedures, individuals in their eligibility waiting period, and those on COBRA. Notably, everyone is approved without the need for a medical exam.

The program does not include deductibles, pre-existing condition limitations, medical exams, claim forms, usage limitations, or age restrictions, except for work already in progress. It is a reduced fee-for-service program and not an insurance plan. All household members are included, regardless of age, and students away at college are also covered. Participants must pay for services at the time they are rendered, but discounts are available when using participating providers. The program does not meet the requirements of the PPACA and is not available in certain states, including Alaska, Montana, Rhode Island, Utah, Vermont, and Washington.

For those with existing insurance, enrollment in the GapAfford Plus program is still possible, provided the provider accepts both. It is recommended to consult with the provider before treatment to ensure coordination of benefits and additional savings.

13.summary:
The OUTLOOK Vision network offers access to over 12,000 eye care locations nationwide, including ophthalmologists, optometrists, independent optical centers, and national chain locations. The vision program provides significant savings on various optical products and services. Members can save between 10% to 50% on most prescription eyeglasses, frames, and lenses through the extensive network. Additionally, there are savings on contact lenses, excluding disposables, at participating retail locations. Discounts of 10% to 30% are also available on medical eye exams and surgical procedures such as PRK and LASIK, where available and approved.

The document includes a sample vision care savings table, illustrating potential savings at different locations. For example, at Exact Eye Care in Kearney, NE, a frame single vision with polycarbonate is available at a retail price of $129.00, with a member price of $90.30, resulting in a 30% savings. Similar savings are detailed for other locations and products, highlighting the financial benefits of the program.

A list of some participating vision care providers is also provided, including well-known chains such as Pearle Vision, Sears Optical, and Lenscrafters, among others. This extensive network ensures that members have access to a wide range of options for their vision care needs.

14.summary:
The pharmacy discount program offers significant savings on prescription medications, allowing users to save an average of 55% on generic drugs and 15% on brand-name drugs. This program is accepted at over 80% of pharmacies across the United States, providing a wide national network for users. All FDA-approved drugs, including lifestyle medications, are available at reduced rates. There is no limit on the number of prescriptions that can be filled using this card, and it includes coverage for pet medications as well.

The card is pre-activated and never expires, allowing immediate use without the need for any forms or activation processes. It covers the entire household with no exclusions, ensuring that all family members can benefit from the discounts. Importantly, personal information is never collected from the card user, maintaining privacy and security.

To utilize the discounts, members simply present their member ID card to the pharmacist along with their prescription. The program emphasizes ease of use and accessibility, with no additional steps required to access the benefits. This discount card is not an insurance plan but a program designed to reduce the cost of medications for users.

15.summary:
The RX Mail-Order program by MedAfford Global offers significant savings on prescription medications, with potential discounts of up to 80% and insulin medication savings of 45% or more. The process is designed to be convenient, easy, and secure. To begin, customers can price their medications online at the provided website link. Orders can be placed online or by calling the specified phone number, where customers must provide their Rx Group number. A valid prescription from a doctor is required to complete the order. Once the order is placed, medications are shipped directly to the customer, with email confirmation provided.

The document lists commonly ordered brand-name medications with their average prices based on a 90-day supply. For example, Abilify 10mg is priced at $160, Advair Diskus 50/250mcg 180 doses at $144, and Eliquis 5mg 180 tabs at $236. Additionally, commonly ordered generic medications are listed, such as Amlodipine 10mg for $20 and Lisinopril 20mg for $22. These prices do not include a $4.95 shipping fee or the cost of insurance for shipment. The program is administered by National Benefit Builders, Inc., and it is important to note that this is a discount program, not insurance.

16.summary:
The document introduces the benefits of incorporating CBD into daily health routines, highlighting its natural ingredients and the purest form of Cannabidiol. It positions CBD as a safe and effective alternative to prescription painkillers for families and pets. CBD, or cannabidiol, is a compound found in hemp plants, known for supporting peace and balance without intoxication. The text emphasizes the non-altering effects of CBD, making it suitable for everyday use. The company, CBD Afford, selects vendors offering products that promote a healthier, plant-based lifestyle. The document acknowledges the complexity of CBD information and aims to be a resource for better health understanding.

The document outlines the unique aspects of their CBD products, including compliance with the Farm Bill Act of 2018, ensuring legal standards are met. It emphasizes the highest quality of pharmacist-formulated full-spectrum CBD products, focusing on purity and potency. The products undergo multi-stage third-party lab testing to verify ingredient potency. Additionally, each package includes QR codes linked to lab results, providing transparency and assurance of quality to consumers.

presentation.content:
**Cover (1 slide)**
- **Plan Name:** Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance
- **Tagline:** "Structured Support for Your Healthcare Needs"

**Plan Overview (1 slide)**
- **Target Audience:** Individuals and families seeking supplemental healthcare coverage.
- **Offerings:** Provides fixed indemnity benefits to manage unexpected medical expenses.
- **Key Benefits:** Flexibility in provider choice, predictable financial support, and access to the Multiplan PPO Network.

**Core Plan Elements (2-3 slides)**
- **Coverage Areas:** Includes physician services, hospitalization, and virtual visits.
- **Plan Structure:** Offers tiered options with fixed payments, co-pays, and visit limits.
- **Eligibility:** Available to individuals and families, focusing on affordability and accessibility.

**Common Service Features (2-3 slides)**
- **Provider Networks:** Access to the extensive Multiplan PPO Network.
- **Claims Management:** Simplified claims process with direct payment of benefits.
- **Support Tools:** Includes wellness programs and advocacy services for enhanced member support.

**Plan Tiers Breakdown (8-12 slides)**

**Plan 100**
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $100 per day
  - ICU Confinement: $200 per day
  - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $50 per visit, 3 visits per year
  - No procedure benefits

**Plan 200**
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $200 per day
  - ICU Confinement: $200 per day
  - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $50 per visit, 3 visits per year
  - Lab and X-Rays: $50 per service
  - Advanced Diagnostic: $50 per service

**Plan 200+**
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $200 per day
  - ICU Confinement: $200 per day
  - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $50 per visit, 3 visits per year
  - Lab and X-Rays: $50 per service
  - Advanced Diagnostic: $50 per service
  - Surgery: $250 per day, 3 days per year
  - Anesthesia: 25%

**Plan 300**
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $300 per day
  - ICU Confinement: $300 per day
  - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $50 per visit, 3 visits per year
  - Surgery: $250 per day, 3 days per year
  - Anesthesia: 25%

**Plan 500**
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $500 per day
  - ICU Confinement: $500 per day
  - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $50 per visit, 5 visits per year
  - Lab and X-Rays: $50 per service
  - Advanced Diagnostic: $50 per service
  - Surgery: $350 per day, 3 days per year
  - Anesthesia: 25%

**Plan 750**
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $750 per day
  - ICU Confinement: $750 per day
  - Emergency Room: $75 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $50 per visit, 5 visits per year
  - Lab and X-Rays: $50 per service
  - Advanced Diagnostic: $50 per service
  - Surgery: $400 per day, 3 days per year
  - Anesthesia: 25%

**Plan 1000**
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $1000 per day
  - ICU Confinement: $1000 per day
  - Emergency Room: $100 per visit
  - Physician's Office: $75 per visit, 5 visits per year
  - Lab and X-Rays: $75 per service
  - Advanced Diagnostic: $75 per service
  - Surgery: $500 per day, 3 days per year
  - Anesthesia: 25%

**Plan 1000+**
- **Benefits:**
  - Hospital Confinement: $1000 per day
  - ICU Confinement: $1000 per day
  - Emergency Room: $100 per visit
  - Hospital Admission: $1000 per admission
  - Physician's Office: $75 per visit, 5 visits per year
  - Lab and X-Rays: $100 per service
  - Advanced Diagnostic: $100 per service
  - Surgery: $500 per day, 3 days per year
  - Anesthesia: 25%

**Comparison Slides (Markdown Table)**

| Benefit Category       | Plan 100 | Plan 200 | Plan 200+ | Plan 300 | Plan 500 | Plan 750 | Plan 1000 | Plan 1000+ |
|------------------------|----------|----------|-----------|----------|----------|----------|-----------|------------|
| Hospital Confinement   | $100     | $200     | $200      | $300     | $500     | $750     | $1000     | $1000      |
| ICU Confinement        | $200     | $200     | $200      | $300     | $500     | $750     | $1000     | $1000      |
| Emergency Room         | $50      | $50      | $50       | $50      | $50      | $75      | $100      | $100       |
| Hospital Admission     | N/A      | N/A      | N/A       | N/A      | N/A      | N/A      | N/A       | $1000      |
| Physician's Office     | $50      | $50      | $50       | $50      | $50      | $50      | $75       | $75        |
| Lab and X-Rays         | N/A      | $50      | $50       | N/A      | $50      | $50      | $75       | $100       |
| Advanced Diagnostic    | N/A      | $50      | $50       | N/A      | $50      | $50      | $75       | $100       |
| Surgery                | N/A      | N/A      | $250      | $250     | $350     | $400     | $500      | $500       |
| Anesthesia             | N/A      | N/A      | 25%       | 25%      | 25%      | 25%      | 25%       | 25%        |

**Limitations and Exclusions (1-2 slides)**
- **Exclusions:** Pre-existing conditions, elective treatments, experimental procedures, and certain sports-related injuries.
- **Limitations:** Waiting periods, specific service exclusions, and geographic restrictions.

**Key Takeaways and Action Steps (1 slide)**
- **Flexibility:** Offers a range of plans to suit different needs and budgets.
- **Cost vs. Coverage:** Balances affordability with essential coverage.
- **Next Steps:** Contact a representative for enrollment details and support.

**Thank You (1 slide)**
- **Message:** "Thank you for considering Everest Reinsurance Group for your healthcare needs. We are here to support you every step of the way."

--- id: FEN_everest_reinsurance_group_fixed_indemnity_insurance_with_multiplan_ppo_network theme: ../../ title: | Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance info: | ## Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance Review A look at the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance benefits and details. verticalCenter: true layout: intro themeConfig: logoHeader: ./img/logos/FEN_logo.svg audioEnabled: true transition: fade-out drawings: persist: false --- # Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance Review Understanding the details and benefits of the **Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance with Multiplan PPO Network** --- transition: fade-out layout: default --- ## Everest Reinsurance Group Overview - Offered through **NCE** - **Fixed Indemnity Benefits** for specific medical services - **Multiplan PPO Network** for flexible provider choices - **Structured Approach** to healthcare coverage - **Supplemental Insurance** for additional financial support --- transition: fade-out layout: default --- ## Key Features and Benefits **Fixed Indemnity Benefits** **Multiplan PPO Network** **Structured Coverage** **Supplemental Support** (varies by plan) **Direct Payment of Benefits** through Everest

transition: fade-out layout: one-half-img image: img/pages/plan_brochure_image_1.jpg --- ## Plan 300 (1/2) **Confinement Benefits** - 30 Days Per Confinement - 90 Days Per Certificate Year - Hospital Confinement: $300 - ICU Confinement: $300 **Hospital Benefits** - Emergency Room: $50 - 2 visits per certificate year **Outpatient Benefits** - Physician's Office: $50 - 3 visits per certificate year --- transition: fade-out layout: one-half-img image: img/pages/plan_brochure_image_1.jpg --- ## Plan 300 (2/2) **Procedure Benefits** - Surgery: $250 per day - Anesthesia: 25% **Advanced Diagnostic** - N/A --- transition: fade-out layout: default --- ## Comparing the Plans | **Feature** | **Plan 100** | **Plan 200** | **Plan 200+** | **Plan 300** | |---------|----------|----------|-----------|-----------| | Benefit Eligibility | 12-12 Pre-Existing Conditions | 12-12 Pre-Existing Conditions | 12-12 Pre-Existing Conditions | 12-12 Pre-Existing | $300 | | ICU Confinement | $200 | $200 | $200 | $300 | | Hospital Benefits | Emergency Room 2 per certificate year | Emergency Room 2 per certificate year | Emergency Room 2 per certificate year | Emergency Room 2 per certificate year | | Hospital Admission | N/A | N/A | N/A | N/A | | Emergency Room | $50 | $50 | $50 | $50 | | Procedure Benefits | N/A | N/A | Surgery-3 maximum days per certificate year (maximum days are shared between inpatient and outpatient) | Surgery-3 maximum days per certificate year (maximum days are shared between inpatient and outpatient) | | Surgery | N/A | N/A | Combined Inpatient & Outpatient $250 per day | Combined Inpatient & Outpatient $250 per day | | Anesthesia | N/A | N/A | 25% | 25% | | Outpatient Benefits | Physician's Office-3 per certificate year | X-Rays & Labs-4 covered days per certificate year/Advanced Diagnostic-covered days per certificate year/Physician's Office-3 per certificate year | X-Rays & Labs-4 covered days per certificate year/Advanced Diagnostic-covered days per certificate year/Physician's Office-3 per certificate year | Physician's Office-3 per certificate year | | Lab | N/A | $50 | $50 | N/A | | X-Rays | N/A | $50 | $50 | N/A | | Advanced Diagnostic | N/A | $50 | $50 | N/A | | Physician's Office | $50 | $50 | $50 | $50 | --- transition: fade-out layout: one-half-img image: img/pages/plan_brochure_image_final.jpg --- ## Definitions and Limitations **Pre-existing Conditions** - 12-12 Limitation - Applies to all plans - Excludes coverage for 12 months **Coverage Exclusions** - Chiropractic and Acupuncture - Cosmetic Surgery **Benefit Limitations** - Per person - Varies by state **Policy Terms** - May vary by state - Not all benefits available in all states --- transition: fade-out layout: default --- ## Key Takeaways and Reminders - **Fixed Indemnity** benefits - **Multiplan PPO Network** included - **Structured Coverage** benefits - **Enrollment through NCE** required --- transition: fade-out layout: end line: Thank you for participating in the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance Review. script.content:
---- Cover ----

Hello, everyone! Thank you for joining today's session on the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance. We'll walk through this plan's features and benefits, designed to provide structured support for your healthcare needs. Let's get started!

---- Everest Reinsurance Group Overview ----

The Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance is offered through NCE. 

This plan provides Fixed Indemnity Benefits, which means you receive a set payment amount for specific medical services. 

With access to the Multiplan PPO Network, you have flexible provider choices. 

The plan takes a structured approach to healthcare coverage, offering supplemental insurance for additional financial support.

Now, let's explore the key features and benefits of this plan.

---- Key Features and Benefits ----

This plan offers Fixed Indemnity Benefits, providing predictable financial support for medical services. 

The Multiplan PPO Network is included, allowing for a wide range of provider choices. 

Structured Coverage ensures that you have a clear understanding of your benefits. 

Supplemental Support varies by plan, offering additional financial assistance when needed.

Direct Payment of Benefits is facilitated through Everest, ensuring a seamless experience.

Let's move on to the cost management tools available with this plan.

---- Cost Management Tools ----

The Multiplan PPO Network, or MPN, is a key component of cost management. 

It offers Flexible Provider Choices, allowing you to select from a broad network of healthcare providers. 

The Structured Financial Support System helps manage your healthcare expenses effectively.

Next, we'll discuss how the Multiplan PPO Network works.

---- How Multiplan PPO Network Works ----

To begin, you enroll through NCE. 

Once enrolled, you gain access to a wide range of providers within the network. 

You can utilize negotiated discounts to manage costs. 

You'll receive an MPN card, which helps you manage healthcare expenses effectively. 

This network provides a Predictable Financial Framework for your healthcare needs.

Let's now look at preventive care and wellness options.

---- Preventive Care and Wellness ----

The plan includes Routine Checkups Services to maintain your health. 

Wellness Programs Initiatives are available to support your overall well-being. 

The Multiplan PPO Network provides diverse options for preventive care.

Now, let's explore the telehealth services offered.

---- Telehealth Services ----

Telehealth services provide 24/7 Access to healthcare professionals. 

You can have Remote Consultations from the comfort of your home. 

This service offers Convenient Care, making healthcare more accessible. 

Easy Access to healthcare is a key benefit of telehealth services.

Let's move on to advocacy and support services.

---- Advocacy and Support Services ----

The plan includes Personalized healthcare advocacy to guide you through your healthcare journey. 

Claims Assistance support is available to help with the claims process. 

Benefit Options guidance ensures you understand your coverage. 

Healthcare Navigation support is provided to help you make informed decisions.

Now, let's examine the first plan tier, Plan 100.

---- Plan 100 (One of Two) ----

Plan 100 offers Confinement Benefits, including thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Hospital Confinement is covered at one hundred dollars per day, and ICU Confinement at two hundred dollars per day. 

Hospital Benefits include Emergency Room visits at fifty dollars per visit, with two visits per certificate year. 

Outpatient Benefits cover Physician's Office visits at fifty dollars per visit, with three visits per certificate year.

Continuing with Plan 100, let's look at the procedure benefits.

---- Plan 100 (Two of Two) ----

Procedure Benefits for Plan 100 do not include surgery or anesthesia coverage. 

Advanced Diagnostic services are not covered under this plan.

Now, let's look at our second plan tier, Plan 200.

---- Plan 200 (One of Two) ----

Plan 200 provides Confinement Benefits with thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Hospital Confinement is covered at two hundred dollars per day, and ICU Confinement at two hundred dollars per day. 

Hospital Benefits include Emergency Room visits at fifty dollars per visit, with two visits per certificate year. 

Outpatient Benefits cover X-Rays and Labs at fifty dollars per service, and Advanced Diagnostic services at fifty dollars per service.

Continuing with Plan 200, let's explore the procedure benefits.

---- Plan 200 (Two of Two) ----

Procedure Benefits for Plan 200 do not include surgery or anesthesia coverage. 

Physician's Office visits are covered at fifty dollars per visit, with three visits per certificate year.

Now, let's examine Plan 200+.

---- Plan 200+ (One of Two) ----

Plan 200+ offers Confinement Benefits with thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Hospital Confinement is covered at two hundred dollars per day, and ICU Confinement at two hundred dollars per day. 

Hospital Benefits include Emergency Room visits at fifty dollars per visit, with two visits per certificate year. 

Outpatient Benefits cover X-Rays and Labs at fifty dollars per service, and Advanced Diagnostic services at fifty dollars per service.

Continuing with Plan 200+, let's look at the procedure benefits.

---- Plan 200+ (Two of Two) ----

Procedure Benefits for Plan 200+ include Surgery at two hundred fifty dollars per day, with anesthesia covered at twenty-five percent. 

Physician's Office visits are covered at fifty dollars per visit, with three visits per certificate year.

Now, let's look at Plan 300.

---- Plan 300 (One of Two) ----

Plan 300 provides Confinement Benefits with thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year. 

Hospital Confinement is covered at three hundred dollars per day, and ICU Confinement at three hundred dollars per day. 

Hospital Benefits include Emergency Room visits at fifty dollars per visit, with two visits per certificate year. 

Outpatient Benefits cover Physician's Office visits at fifty dollars per visit, with three visits per certificate year.

Continuing with Plan 300, let's explore the procedure benefits.

---- Plan 300 (Two of Two) ----

Procedure Benefits for Plan 300 include Surgery at two hundred fifty dollars per day, with anesthesia covered at twenty-five percent. 

Advanced Diagnostic services are not covered under this plan.

Let's compare the different tiers available.

---- Comparing the Plans ----

Here is a comparison of the plans, focusing on key benefits. 

Plan 100 offers hospital confinement at one hundred dollars per day, while Plan 200 and Plan 200+ offer two hundred dollars per day, and Plan 300 offers three hundred dollars per day. 

ICU confinement follows the same structure. 

Emergency Room visits are covered at fifty dollars per visit across all plans. 

Plan 200+ and Plan 300 include surgery benefits, with Plan 200+ offering two hundred fifty dollars per day and Plan 300 offering the same amount. 

Anesthesia is covered at twenty-five percent for both Plan 200+ and Plan 300.

Let's review important definitions and limitations.

---- Definitions and Limitations ----

Pre-existing Conditions have a twelve-month exclusion period, applying to all plans. 

Coverage Exclusions include chiropractic and acupuncture services, as well as cosmetic surgery. 

Benefit Limitations are per person and may vary by state. 

Policy Terms may also vary by state, and not all benefits are available in all states.

Here are the key points to remember.

---- Key Takeaways and Reminders ----

The plan offers Fixed Indemnity benefits, providing predictable financial support. 

The Multiplan PPO Network is included, offering flexible provider choices. 

Structured Coverage benefits ensure clarity in your healthcare plan. 

Enrollment through NCE is required to access these benefits.

Thank you for your time today. We hope this information helps you make informed decisions about your health coverage. Continue to be great!

---- Closing ----

Thank you for considering Everest Reinsurance Group for your healthcare needs. We are here to support you every step of the way. Continue to be great!

slide.content:
## Comparing the Plans

| **Feature** | **Plan 100** | **Plan 200** | **Plan 200+** | **Plan 300** |
|---------|----------|----------|-----------|-----------|
| Benefit Eligibility | 12-12 Pre-Existing Conditions | 12-12 Pre-Existing Conditions | 12-12 Pre-Existing Conditions | 12-12 Pre-Existing Conditions |
| Underwriting Level | Guaranteed Issue | Guaranteed Issue | Guaranteed Issue | Guaranteed Issue |
| Confinement Benefits | 30 Days Per Confinement/90 Days Per Certificate Year | 30 Days Per Confinement/90 Days Per Certificate Year | 30 Days Per Confinement/90 Days Per Certificate Year | 30 Days Per Confinement/90 Days Per Certificate Year |
| Hospital Confinement | $100 | $200 | $200 | $300 |
| ICU Confinement | $200 | $200 | $200 | $300 |
| Hospital Benefits | Emergency Room 2 per certificate year | Emergency Room 2 per certificate year | Emergency Room 2 per certificate year | Emergency Room 2 per certificate year |
| Hospital Admission | N/A | N/A | N/A | N/A |
| Emergency Room | $50 | $50 | $50 | $50 |
| Procedure Benefits | N/A | N/A | Surgery-3 maximum days per certificate year (maximum days are shared between inpatient and outpatient) | Surgery-3 maximum days per certificate year (maximum days are shared between inpatient and outpatient) |
| Surgery | N/A | N/A | Combined Inpatient & Outpatient $250 per day | Combined Inpatient & Outpatient $250 per day |
| Anesthesia | N/A | N/A | 25% | 25% |
| Outpatient Benefits | Physician's Office-3 per certificate year | X-Rays & Labs-4 covered days per certificate year/Advanced Diagnostic-covered days per certificate year/Physician's Office-3 per certificate year | X-Rays & Labs-4 covered days per certificate year/Advanced Diagnostic-covered days per certificate year/Physician's Office-3 per certificate year | Physician's Office-3 per certificate year |
| Lab | N/A | $50 | $50 | N/A |
| X-Rays | N/A | $50 | $50 | N/A |
| Advanced Diagnostic | N/A | $50 | $50 | N/A |
| Physician's Office | $50 | $50 | $50 | $50 |
slide.frontmatter:
transition: fade-out
layout: default

script.content:
Here is a comparison of the plans, focusing on key benefits. 

Plan 100 offers hospital confinement at one hundred dollars per day, while Plan 200 and Plan 200+ offer two hundred dollars per day, and Plan 300 offers three hundred dollars per day. 

ICU confinement follows the same structure. 

Emergency Room visits are covered at fifty dollars per visit across all plans. 

Plan 200+ and Plan 300 include surgery benefits, with Plan 200+ offering two hundred fifty dollars per day and Plan 300 offering the same amount. 

Anesthesia is covered at twenty-five percent for both Plan 200+ and Plan 300.

Let's review important definitions and limitations.

slide.content:
## Definitions and Limitations

<v-click>

**Pre-existing Conditions**
- 12-12 Limitation
- Applies to all plans
- Excludes coverage for 12 months
<Arrow v-bind="{ x1:480, y1:160, x2:550, y2:160, color: 'var(--slidev-theme-accent)' }" />
</v-click>

<v-click>

**Coverage Exclusions**
- Chiropractic and Acupuncture
- Cosmetic Surgery
<Arrow v-bind="{ x1:480, y1:255, x2:550, y2:255, color: 'var(--slidev-theme-accent)' }" />
</v-click>

<v-click>

**Benefit Limitations**
- Per person
- Varies by state
<Arrow v-bind="{ x1:480, y1:360, x2:550, y2:360, color: 'var(--slidev-theme-accent)' }" />
</v-click>

<v-click>

**Policy Terms**
- May vary by state
- Not all benefits available in all states
<Arrow v-bind="{ x1:480, y1:420, x2:550, y2:420, color: 'var(--slidev-theme-accent)' }" />
</v-click>
slide.frontmatter:
transition: fade-out
layout: one-half-img
image: img/pages/plan_brochure_image_final.jpg

script.content:
Pre-existing Conditions have a twelve-month exclusion period, applying to all plans. 

Coverage Exclusions include chiropractic and acupuncture services, as well as cosmetic surgery. 

Benefit Limitations are per person and may vary by state. 

Policy Terms may also vary by state, and not all benefits are available in all states.

Here are the key points to remember.

slide.content:
## Key Takeaways and Reminders

<v-clicks>

- **Fixed Indemnity** benefits
- **Multiplan PPO Network** included
- **Structured Coverage** benefits
- **Enrollment through NCE** required

</v-clicks>
slide.frontmatter:
transition: fade-out
layout: default

script.content:
The plan offers Fixed Indemnity benefits, providing predictable financial support. 

The Multiplan PPO Network is included, offering flexible provider choices. 

Structured Coverage benefits ensure clarity in your healthcare plan. 

Enrollment through NCE is required to access these benefits.

Thank you for your time today. We hope this information helps you make informed decisions about your health coverage. Continue to be great!
